messages.title: Vote Labour in 2015
messages.content: Vote for Labour is a vote for an increased minimum wage, freezing energy bills, protecting our NHS, free childcare, and much more.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Fighting to establish a West Hampstead Transport Group of residents to pressure Transport for London to invest in local transport services.
Meetings with local parents and nursery workers about Labour's plans for 25 hours of free childcare for working parents.
Labour team in Kilburn holds street meetings with hundreds of local residents to give advice on housing, visas, and policing issues.
Campaigns against the rising number of payday lenders and rouge landlords on Kilburn High Road.
Supports local residents on Abbey Road in their fight against the 'Stop The Tower' campaign.
Acknowledges with local residents over a 1000 new council homes for local people being built on Liddell Road. Thanks to Labour’s Camden Council.
Fights against HS2 for five years and will continue to challenge the unfair and disruptive High Speed Rail (London - West Midlands) Bill and its proposed ventilation shaft and construction sites.

housing.content: Labour team in Kilburn holds street meetings with hundreds of local residents to give advice on housing, visas, and policing issues.

leaflet.personalStatement: Why you should vote Labour in Hampstead and Kilburn in 2015

images.caption: Tulip Siddiq, working for you across Hampstead and Kilburn. Why you should vote Labour in Hampstead and Kilburn in 2015.
